justification: The reduction of GHG emissions can lead to increased food production and reduced losses, making food more affordable and accessible.
The implementation of GHG reduction targets may require significant changes in agricultural practices, potentially constraining the competitiveness of the agricultural sector.
The reduction of GHG emissions from transportation can improve air quality, reinforcing the quality of food products.
The implementation of GHG removal targets can lead to the adoption of more sustainable agricultural practices, reducing the use of pesticides and reinforcing their reduction.
The improvement of climate resilience can create conditions for better working conditions and social protection for workers, enabling the achievement of social security targets.
The reduction of GHG emissions from buildings can lead to improved indoor air quality, enabling the achievement of healthy food targets.
The reduction of GHG emissions can lead to improved animal welfare, enabling the achievement of animal welfare targets.
